Player History
Drafted in 4th round, 71st overall pick, by California in 1970...
Had first career hit on 4/29/1978, off Nelson Briles (CLE)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/20/1980, off Terry Leach (BOS)...
Drafted in 3rd round, 59th overall pick, by Minnesota in 1987...
Injured on 7/20/1988 with a Bruised Hand, out for 5 days...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/19/1990, off Jose Rijo (CAL)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/22/1990, off Tom Glavine (OAK)...
Had 5 hits with 0 RBI against Cleveland on 6/15/1993...
Had 5 hits with 1 RBI against Oakland on 9/16/1996...
Won Gold Glove Award at Third Base in 1997...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/21/1998, hitting .583 with 3 HR, 6 RBI...
Traded from Minnesota to Chicago (N) on 7/31/1998 (Going to CHC: 3B B. Spiers, DH D. Palmer, P P. Harnisch. Going to MIN: LF L. Berkman, CF G. Matthews Jr., 1B B. Fullmer, P E. Gagne, P G. Balfour
